cont.entity_a: Only one cord is retractable, which is a disadvantage compared to models with both wires retracting. Cord is too short, requiring a separate extension purchase.
The headphones are very comfortable, more so than earbuds. Fit well but can pinch after extended wear. Clip-on attachments are secure and comfortable. Fit is too loose, affecting sound quality.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable fit, but loose on smaller heads. Headphones are loose and can fall off easily.

cont.entity_a: Sound quality is clear and loud, but treble is more prominent than bass, requiring equalizer adjustments. Bass response is lacking. Generally good audio quality, but not exceptional.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is good for TV, but not recommended for music. Sound quality is great for TV, like in a theater. Sound quality is fairly good but requires careful sender unit orientation to avoid interference. Sound quality is crisp and clear, both for music and voices.

cont.entity_a: The headphones stopped working after two months without visible damage. Cables are thin, raising concerns about long-term durability.
cont.entity_b: Stopped working after 2.5 years, with static and no broadcast signal.

cont.entity_a: Retractable mechanism works well and prevents tangling. Retractable mechanism is better than previous models.
Appearance is less impressive than expected, being white plastic instead of clear.
Background white noise occurs about 20% of the time.
cont.entity_b: Solves issues with hearing multiple conversations or noises in the same room. Loud static occurs if audio stops for one minute. Static pops and clicks are present, affecting sound quality. Some static and popping sounds occur when moving.
Wireless technology is poor for office environments, with audio only clear in one channel.
Headphones are easy to operate with physical power switch and volume scroll wheel. Charging is automatic when placed on the stand.
Difficult setup with confusing manual instructions.
Volume control can be difficult to find and use.
